revised_title: Direct Measurement of Normal and Retarded Van der Waals Forces
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to measure the forces between molecularly smooth mica surfaces, revealing two types of van der Waals forces: normal and retarded. They found that the transition between these forces occurs when the separation between the surfaces is around 15 nanometers. The study provides insights into the behavior of real and ideal gases, as well as the strength properties of solids and the stability of colloids and foams.
